cyclone.name: ISAIAS
cyclone.current_location: about 175 mi SSE of Nassau, Bahamas
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest across the Bahamas, then turning north-northwest and running very close to the east coast of the Florida peninsula
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: closest coastal approach near the southeast Florida coast between Fort Lauderdale and West Palm Beach

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hallandale Beach to south of Boca Raton, FL
weather_observation.warning_coast: North of Ocean Reef to south of Boca Raton, FL
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire southeast Florida coast from Miami-Dade through the Space Coast
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds likely; brief hurricane-force gusts possible Saturday night into early Sunday (29% chance of ≥50-kt sustained winds).
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–3 ft of inundation possible along the Broward County coast including Port Everglades if peak surge coincides with high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches with localized 6 inches could cause ponding and localized flash flooding around port facilities.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents; short-fused tornadoes in rain bands; operational disruptions to vessel traffic and cargo handling.
